message_1:
Consider the following substitution cipher: 

A → F, B → X, C → J, D → U, E → L, F → E, G → Z, H → Q, I → N, J → T, K → O, L → R, M → Y, N → W, O → V, P → S, Q → D, R → I, S → H, T → G, U → M, V → P, W → K, X → A, Y → B, Z → C

Encrypt the message "MATH IS FUN" using this substitution cipher.
message_2:
Using the given substitution cipher, we can encrypt the message "MATH IS FUN" as follows:

M → Y
A → F
T → G
H → Q
I → N
S → H
F → E
U → M
N → W

So, the encrypted message is "YFGQ NH EMW".
